value.label: UI
value.description: Retrieves UI-related data previously stored in the default storage. Use this to validate or reuse captured UI state during a test.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves stored test data by key from the default storage. Use this to access an object that was previously stored using an enum key representing an API endpoint or result.

value.label: DB
value.description: Retrieves stored test data from the default storage where the key represents a query or database interaction result. Use this when validating database state in tests.

value.label: UI
value.description: Retrieves UI test data from sub-storage. Use this when the UI data is grouped in sub-contexts (e.g., by feature or component). The first parameter indicates the UI sub-context, the second is the key for the stored data, and the third is the expected return type.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves stored test data from a sub-storage structure using a sub-key and a main key. Use this when the test data is grouped into nested storage (e.g., by module or feature). The first parameter identifies the sub-storage context, the second is the key for the stored entity, and the third is the expected return type.

value.label: DB
value.description: Retrieves a database query result from sub-storage. The first parameter points to the database sub-context, the second represents the query identifier, and the third is the expected result type.

value.label: UI
value.description: Retrieves specific UI-related test data using a custom extractor. Use this for accessing dynamic UI elements such as rows in a table, cells, or component states based on filtering criteria or index.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves a specific value from stored API data using a custom extractor. Use this when you need to extract a particular field or structure from a stored API response body, status, or header using logic such as JSON path.

value.label: DB
value.description: Retrieves structured database test data using a custom extractor. This is useful for pulling specific fields or records from stored database query results using advanced filtering or mapping logic.

value.label: UI
value.description: Retrieves a specific row or component from UI storage using a custom extractor and index. Useful for extracting the first, second, or N-th element from a UI list or table.

value.label: API
value.description: Retrieves test data from stored API responses using a custom extractor and returns the item at the specified index. Use this when the stored response is a list or array and you want to extract a specific element.

value.label: DB
value.description: Retrieves a database record from a result list using a custom extractor and specified index. Use this to access individual entries in query results.

value.label: UI
value.description: Switches into the UI world to interact with visual components, perform UI actions, and assert front-end behaviors through fluent test steps.

value.label: API
value.description: Switches into the API world to perform RESTful operations like sending requests, validating status codes, and asserting response data using fluent methods.

value.label: DB
value.description: Switches into the DB world to execute database-related validations such as querying persisted data and asserting stored values after an operation.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Marks the end of the test execution. This method clears all temporary test data, asserts collected soft validations, and finalizes the test run. It must be called at the end of every test to ensure proper validation and cleanup.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Defines one or more setup steps (journeys) to be executed before the test runs. Each journey represents a reusable precondition like creating test data or configuring state.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Specifies a precondition step to run before the test method using a named journey and optional journey data. Can be used within @PreQuest or directly if only one journey is needed.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Used inside a Journey annotation to define what test data model should be used as input for the precondition setup. The value is typically an enum constant representing a data model, and 'late' can be used to resolve the data later during test execution.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Demonstrates using the 'late' flag when the journey's data depends on a previously executed journey step. Use this for deferred resolution of data.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Specifies post-test cleanup actions to execute after the test completes. Used to remove test data or reset test environment state.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Injects test data into method parameters using predefined data models. The model parameter refers to a test data enum used to dynamically generate and inject data into the test.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Demonstrates usage of multiple @Craft-injected parameters to simulate different data instances during test execution, one of which is resolved lazily via Late<>.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Marks a single test method as part of the regression suite. This enables filtering of specific tests tagged as 'Regression' in CI pipelines or test runners.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Used at the class level to apply the regression tag to all test methods within the class. Suitable when the entire class contains regression-related tests.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Marks a single test method as part of the smoke suite. Perfect for quickly checking the most critical features before deeper testing.

value.label: Framework
value.description: Applied to a test class to mark all tests within as smoke tests. Useful when the entire class consists of core scenario checks.
